lexUnit.name: allergy.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a damaging immune response by the body to a substance to which it has become hypersensitive

sentence.text: Hay fever is really an allergy to pollen and the peak time is early June .
Then I was tested for allergies to the serums and taught how and where to inject myself .
He developed an allergy to a powerful , broad-spectrum antibiotic he had been given to treat an attack of bronchitis .

The sun is really hot and I am in big trouble ( I have an allergy to sunlight ) .
On top of this , he has allergies to oats and dust and is a finicky feeder .
I have an allergy to them .
But later she developed an allergy to feathers , and that made it very difficult for her when I wanted to keep birds in the house !

There may not be a guaranteed cure for your allergy .
Peter immediately explained Carol 's codeine allergy but the doctor replied : ` But she 's had some already . "

There are at least 20 types of sun allergy , caused by UVA and possibly UVB radiation being absorbed by a chemical in the skin .

Many cases of childhood eczema may be due to allergy to cow 's milk , but some 50 per cent or so may clear up quite spontaneously , without any change in diet .
